alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 05 at 8:38AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Renewed Flooding of Rivers and Poor Drainage Areas is Possible Sunday night into Monday... Scattered to numerous showers and a few thunderstorms will develop tonight into Sunday, along and ahead of a cold front sagging southeast into the region. However, the heaviest and most widespread rainfall is expected Sunday night and Monday morning. Several rivers are still above flood stage from previous rains last week. From 1 to 3 inches of rain is possible through Monday morning over much of the quad state region, with highest amounts expected over portions of southeast Missouri and locations along and north of the Ohio River. This rainfall could prolong ongoing flooding on the mainstem rivers, and renewed flooding could develop on the smaller rivers. There is also the potential for some flooding of poor drainage and flood prone areas. Thunderstorm activity could result in isolated very heavy rainfall rates that could further tax drainage systems, especially if storms manage to train over the same locations. This hydrologic outlook serves to give advance notice of the potential of heavy rainfall that could produce some flooding impacts. Monitor later forecasts and outlooks if you live in a flood prone area.
